AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Cloak of Fear

GameModifier.Provides: Enemies must make a spell resistance check or they are unable to attack a unit protected by this enchantment.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Coal Stones

GameModifier.Provides: Lances of fire strike all enemy units for double the caster's level in fire damage. This damage is halved if the victim resists.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to use the Command ability
Allows the unit to cast Confusion

GameModifier.Provides: All enemies have a 50% chance to swing at a random unit in melee instead of their target, unless they resist.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Consume Spirit
Allows the unit to cast Contagion

GameModifier.Provides: All enemy units take 2 poison damage (+1 per death shard) per turn for 10 turns, unless they resist.

Allows the unit to use the Crushing Blow ability

GameModifier.Provides: Curshing Blow- Launch an Attack with +1 per Stamina

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Curse

GameModifier.Provides: Target has no Defense for 3 turns unless they resist

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Completely heals the unit and does the amount healed as poison damage to all enemies

GameModifier.Provides: Heals the caster and does damage equal to the amount healed to all enemies

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Death Ward in battle

GameModifier.Provides: If this unit is killed in battle they are resurrected with half their hit points. This enchantment lasts for 5 actions or until the unit is resurrected.

GameModifier.Provides: An attack that does +25% damage for each member of the enemy group.

GameModifier.Provides: Delin's Breath summons a fireball that shoots at all enemies. These fireballs do 18 (+4 per fire shard) fire damage to all units within a 1 tile radius.

Allows the unit to cast Despair

GameModifier.Provides: Transfers 3 hit points per level from all enemies to the caster. That damage is halved if the enemy resists

GameModifier.Provides: Needles of fire shoot at an enemy for for 4 (+2 per level) damage

GameModifier.Provides: Attack for an automatic critical hit

This faction can train Iron Golems with the Blacksmithing technology. Iron Golems are powerful defenders and able to withstand inhuman amounts of damage before being destroyed.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Carved from the carapace of the elemental, the pupil inside this giant yellow orb still moves and looks around. (+50% Growth, +5 Initiative for defending units)
This head is a gruesome reminder of the cost of attempting to appease the titans. (+50% Growth, -50% Unrest)
This fissured black stone still glows with the fire of the elemental lord it used to be a part of. (+50% Growth, Defending units are immune to Fire, Units trained here get Fire Resistance)

GameModifier.Provides: Defending units are Immune to Fire
Units trained here gain the Fire Resistance trait

AbilityBonusOption.Description: The heart of Morian, Ruin of Summer. Deep within his corrupted shell was a heart that still remembered verdant forests and unscarred lands. (+50% growth, Units traind here get the Constitution trait)

GameModifier.Provides: Units trained here gain the Constitution trait

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Broken off of the fallen dragon, this horn is proof of the power of the civilization that holds it. (+50% growth, +1 Fame per season)
The wind howls continually through the mouth of the dismembered head of this elemental lord. (+50% Growth, +3 Attack and Defense for defending units)

Shattered off of the elemental lord, this icy fist is still as cold as the arctic and as hard as granite. (+50% Growth, Defending units are immune to Cold, trained units start with the Cold Resistance trait)

GameModifier.Provides: Defending units are Immune to Cold
Units trained here gain the Cold Resistance trait

AbilityBonusOption.Description: -20 to Spell Resistance
-2 Attack
Enables Conclave improvements and increases research.
Enables Fortress improvements and increases the level of units trained here by 1. Select this to dedicate your city to defense and military pursuits.
Enables Town improvements and increases Zone of Control by 1. Select this to dedicate your city to growth and financial pursuits.
Archivists increase the Research a city provides when it is Producing Research.
Guild Grocers improve the Hit Points of all your units by 5%.
Infirmaries provide additional healing for all units stationed in the city and unit trained in this city start with the Endurance trait (+1 Hit Point per Level).
An Oracle allows you to tap into the magic of Elemental, adding an additional Essence to the city.
Scroll Scribes increase Research by 20% and make scrolls available for your champions to purchase.
Slums increase the Growth of your city by 3, but also increase Unrest by 10%.
Strike Garrisons give all units trained in this city the Impulsive trait (+2 Initiative).
Increases the amount of Gildar produced when a city is Producing Wealth.
Watchtowers provide a Catapult for city defense all units trained here start with the Charge trait (+1 Move and +2 Attack for the first action in combat).
The Academy of Revelation increases the Research produced in all your cities by 10%.
An Almshouse shows a city's compassion for the least of its citizens. It provides 1 Fame per Season.
Amethyst Vaults provide 2 Crystal per season.
This city doesn't receive an unrest penalty based on the amount of cities in your empire.
Gallows remind your citizens of their civic duty. With them there is no Unrest penalty to Production.
Governor's Office gives you +1 Production per Material in all of your cities.
The Mining Guild provides 2 Metal per season.
Prisons reduce Unrest in your cities by 10% but decreases the Growth of this city by 1.
Tenfell University keeps this city's Unrest from reducing its Research.
The Great Arena increases your Faction Prestige by 1. All units trained in this city will have +1 to Attack and +3 to Hit Points.
Placing a Guild Lendinghouse in your city gives you 2000 gildar.
The Guild Tribunal manages all your craftsmen, increasing your production per Material by 2 across your empire.

What was once a natural spring, which remained cool even in the hottest summers, became a popular destination for travelers and a place where even warring tribes could meet in peace and relax. After the cataclysm the waters of the spring were still revered and a magnificent bathhouse was built around them.
The Mint of Ruvenna increases Gildar production in any city it's constructed in. This bonus scales based on the Material yields of the city.

This throne is carved from a single piece of onyx, as brilliant and dark as the sea at night. Anyone standing before it can see their reflection within its depths, but in the reflection they are weak and prostrate.
A legendary wonder of a past age, the Pyre of Anniellum strengthens Fire spells as much as 2 Fire Shards.
The Tower of the Magi increases the spell resistance of all units produced in this city by 10 and protects the city from the spells of enemy casters.
+1 Earth power, -50% to Armor production times.
